Package com.ltsllc.miranda.logcache

Class LoggingCache

java.lang.Object
com.ltsllc.miranda.logcache.LoggingCache
public class LoggingCache extends Object
An object that records objects as they come into the class, keeps a portion of those objects in memory, and recovers itself when asked. A logging cache logs all objects that it takes ownership of to a file. It then keeps some of those objects in memory using a most frequently used algorithm. Finally, the class can rebuild itself from a past file.

    • moveMessageToDisk

      public void moveMessageToDisk(Message message)
      Move a message to disk. Since we log all messages that we take ownership of, there is very little to do. This is mostly a bookkeeping action.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to be moved.

    • loadMessage

      public Message loadMessage(UUID uuid) throws com.ltsllc.commons.LtsllcException, IOException
      Load a message from disk to memory This method affects the currentLoad and uuidToMessage.
      Parameters:
      uuid - The uuid of the message to load
      Throws:
      com.ltsllc.commons.LtsllcException - This method throws this exception if it doesn't recognize the UUID.
      IOException - If there is a problem loading the message.

      Make it so that this object has no record of the message
      Parameters:

    • compact

      public void compact() throws IOException
      Compact the logfile by keeping out the messages not in the system

      A message is not part of the system if it does not appear in any of the uuidTo variables, which happens when a message is delivered.

      This method works by going through the logfile and copying those messages that are referenced elsewhere to another, temporary file. The original logfile is then deleted and then the temporary file is renamed to the logfile.

      Throws:
      IOException - If there is a problem reading or writing a file.

    • shouldRecover

      public boolean shouldRecover()
      Return true if we should recover. The rule for recovery is that, if the logfile exists, then we should recover.
      Returns:
      true if we should recover, false otherwise.

    • recover

      public void recover() throws IOException, com.ltsllc.commons.LtsllcException
      Recover from a crash

      This method reads in the logfile and then deletes it.

      A recover should immediately followed by a compaction.

      This method depends on the ability to get a location in the file where an entry takes place. Unfortunately, Java doesn't provide that capability in a BufferedReader or a FileReader, but it sort of does in an InputStream. Hence, the use of FileInputStream and InputStreamReader.

      Throws:
      IOException
      com.ltsllc.commons.LtsllcException
